snippet: Jihadists in Syria beheaded a half-conscious man believed to be an enemy combatant and a Shiite — only to find that he was a rebel fighter, too.
abstract: Jihadists from Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, rebel group linked to Al Qaeda, behead half-conscious man named Mohamed Fares Marroush in Syrian hospital, believing him to be Shiite enemy combatant; killers later discover Marroush was not Shiite, but a rebel fighter too.
lead_paragraph: Jihadists in Syria beheaded a half-conscious man believed to be an enemy combatant and a Shiite — only to find that he was a rebel fighter, too.

headline.main: Beheading in Syria Is Called a Mistake
headline.print_headline: Fellow Rebel Is Beheaded By Mistake, Jihadists Say
